user_review: I am giving this place solid 5 stars for their take out service and their butter chicken. I must say that I am not an expert when it comes to Indian food, simply because I don't eat it as much. But oh wow, that butter chicken was so good, and I don't usually like butter chicken! Their onion bhajis is a great choice to compliment the creamy sauce, simply delish. I haven't had the full dining experience yet, but I am definitely going back there again!

We really wanted to try some Indian food as we haven't tried any since we got to Montreal (over a week now). We ordered the chicken biryani and the beef vindaloo. So the biryani was not really a biryani but more like a spicy tava pulav but it was sooo good. it had Bell peppers but few pieces of chicken like maybe 3 pieces and that too a bit broken. The quantity was really less. The box wasn't full. Like maybe in between half the box and 3/4th of the box. The beef vindaloo didn't taste like an authentic vindaloo taste. It needed more spice and sourness.
Ordered the naan, saag lamb and chili chicken and was thoroughly impressed with the flavours, portions, pricing, and services. Will go back to try more! They even threw in a free can of ginger ale :)
